intro: Anthemis tinctoria var. parviflora, commonly known as the lesser tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, silver-gray leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters. The plant is known for its strong, aromatic scent and contains compounds such as camphor and thymol, which contribute to its medicinal and historical uses. It typically grows in dry, sunny grasslands and is often found in disturbed soils. Due to its chemical composition, it has been traditionally used in herbal remedies and as a natural insect repellent.
